block.p: When Boston Scientific announced this month that it had hired Sam Leno as its chief financial officer, the company threw in an unusual perk that might make anyone trying to sell a house during the current down market green with envy: it agreed to buy two homes owned by Mr. Leno for a guaranteed minimum price of $1.3 million each.
According to the employment letter filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, one of the homes is in Winona Lake, Ind., near Zimmer Holdings, where Mr. Leno used to work.

When Boston Scientific announced this month that it had hired Sam Leno as its chief financial officer, the company threw in an unusual perk that might make anyone trying to sell a house during the current down market green with envy: it agreed to buy two homes owned by Mr. Leno for a guaranteed minimum price of $1.3 million each.
According to the employment letter filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, one of the homes is in Winona Lake, Ind., near Zimmer Holdings, where Mr. Leno used to work.
Paul Donovan, a Boston Scientific spokesman, declined to say where the other house was, or whether the company had ever offered to buy two homes from the same executive before.
''We're committed to attract and retaining the best people possible,'' Mr. Donovan said.
